full_summary:
### Online Engagement Platform Call for Information
#### Tender Description
Housing, Infrastructure and Communities Canada (HICC) is soliciting information and feedback for an online engagement platform, tools, and services to support the National Infrastructure Assessment (NIA) and the Ministerial Advisory Body's virtual public/stakeholder engagement activities.

#### Objective
The objective of this contract is to procure an existing and proven online engagement platform and associated tools and services to facilitate the NIA's virtual public/stakeholder engagement activities.

#### Scope
The NIA was announced in 2021 as a foundational tool for infrastructure decision-makers across Canada. Following engagement with Canadians, a clear sense emerged that stakeholders see value in the NIA, and there is broad support for the initiative. HICC seeks an online engagement platform and associated engagement services to facilitate all NIA engagement activities and design/develop a website for the advisory body's engagement.

#### Proposed Procurement Process
A open bidding process will be used to invite all qualified suppliers. The Department has proposed the following evaluation criteria for consideration:

• Analysis and reporting tools
• Onboarding training
• Strategic online engagement advice
• Ongoing technical support
• 24/7 bilingual (English and French) moderation of discussions

#### Key Considerations
Respondents are kindly requested to provide their guidance and input regarding the attached statement of work. Key considerations should include:

• Ability to assist with this requirement
• Interest in this requirement
• Comments and feedback regarding the proposed evaluation criteria

#### Timeline and Procedure
The deadline for responses is [2024-07-29T14:00:00]. Responding to this inquiry does not guarantee an invitation to participate in any future Request for Proposals (RFP) or subsequent contracts.
